turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Domestic policy of the Surayud Chulanont government.
turn.2: Thaksin's diplomatic passport was revoked by the Foreign Ministry on 31 December 2006 after the government claimed he had engaged in political activities while in exile.
turn.3: What else was the government accused of?
turn.4: Thai embassies were ordered not to facilitate his travels.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Traditionally, all former prime ministers and foreign ministers of Thailand were permitted to hold on to their diplomatic passport for life.
turn.7: Was he allowed to come back to Thailand?
turn.8: Thaksin later publicly announced that he was quitting politics.
turn.9: What did the people do after he left?
turn.10: Surayud's Defense Minister later announced that the junta would refuse Thaksin's reconciliation offer, claiming that Thailand was being threatened by "ill-intentioned people" and capitalism.
